messages.title: Working with our major employers to secure the best deals for this region's workers
messages.content: We deserve an MP who will work hard to attract private businesses and public investment into Filton and Bradley Stoke. Ian has always promoted our region at every opportunity to bring new employment to our area.

messages.title: This is our chance to have a Member of Parliament with a strong track record for working hard across our constituency
messages.content: Described by the BBC as 'a local councillor with a strong grass roots record for helping people in the area' – your hard work deserves to be recognised.

messages.title: We need a Member of Parliament that really does care about our residents, our region and the sort of society we live in
messages.content: Our constituency needs an MP who will give the big issues impacting on all our lives the attention and focus they deserve.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Affordable housing is becoming more possible and we can help with by more housing to be the norm, not an exception.
Campaigning for major transport links improvements across our area.
I have met workers from all of our manufacturing bases to listen to what those on the shop floor have to say.
We are supporting in particular the importance of local services, including the NHS and policing.
Labour's plan to cut tuition fees would save our local students by supporting Labour's plan to cut fees by £3000.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Political website www.electoralcalculus.com predicts a 'photo finish' in our constituency.

issues.economy: We deserve an MP who will work hard to attract private businesses and public investment into Filton and Bradley Stoke.
issues.education: Labour's plan to cut tuition fees would save our local students by supporting Labour's plan to cut fees by £3000.
issues.health: We are supporting in particular the importance of local services, including the NHS and policing.

housing.content: Affordable housing is becoming more possible and we can help with by more housing to be the norm, not an exception.

politicalExperience.achievements: a strong grass roots record for helping people in the area

images.caption: Labour Shadow Ministers Ed Balls and Rachel Reeves recently joined local candidates Ian Boulton and Jo McCarron in learning about production at Airbus.
Ian meeting local military veterans in his former role as Chair of South Gloucestershire Council.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Since 2010 wages have fallen behind prices; households hard hit with real wages down £1,600. Local voters betrayed over Tory election promises about our local hospitals.
